alert.note: Alert for East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 12 at 3:02AM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Widespread total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with localized heavier amounts. Winds gusting between 50 go 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of panhandle Nebraska and southeast Wyoming. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County
